page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: There is only one church in Westbury, St.Augustine's. It is C. of E. so other denominations travel either to Brackley or Buckingham where there are RomanCatholic, Methodist and other churches. In the 19th. and early 20th.c. the church was at the heart of the village and nearly everyone went to church, often twice on Sundays.The choir was important and a source of great pride even with long Wednesday practices after working all day.There was no work on Sunday except for those who had to tend animals.Today there is a core of about 10 families attending regularly with 20 to 30 at an average service.A recently started children's group is involving more youngsters in the services.The present vicar Rev.J.G Harford continues the work of Jordanus first vicar in 1224,though with 3 extra churches to look after.
